body:
Basically the default behavior of the horizontal axis of the line chart is to graph each plot "as is" for example if you had this data:

	<data value="5">
	<data value="6">
	<data value="7">
	

would graph, `5|6|7`

I would like to make it graph so that it is adding to a value as it goes horizontally so it would graph the numbers like this: `5|11|18` as each step it is adding the value. so first you have 5, then you have 5+6 = 11, then you have 11+7 = 18. So the graph is always going up (unless there is a negative value) as to show the growth over time. 

But I would like this to be something that can be changed at runtime via a property like showGrowthOverTime = true.

I am not even sure what I would need to extend LineChart? LinearAxis?

Thanks!!!
title: Flex: Set LineChart to append dataProvider values horizontally to show growth over time frame
